docs.title: Internet Governance Impact 🌟
docs.text:
Welcome to Internet Governance Impact — a community-driven platform that highlights people, initiatives, and resources strengthening the Internet Governance ecosystem worldwide.

This project brings together: - 🌟 Success Stories showcasing real-world impact in Internet Governance - 📇 Youth IGF Speaker Bank connecting emerging voices with speaking opportunities - 📚 Toolkits, reports, and learning resources for community building and policy engagement

docs.title: 🌐 Explore the Website
docs.text:
This repository is published as a documentation website using MkDocs, designed to be easy to navigate and accessible to the wider community.

👉 Browse the sections below to get started.

The website offers: - clear, structured navigation - searchable content - clean and stable URLs - a community-friendly reading experience

docs.title: 🌟 Success Stories
docs.text:
Real stories from individuals, communities, and organizations showing how engagement, advocacy, and collaboration create meaningful change in Internet Governance.

👉 Browse Success Stories Go to Success Stories →

docs.title: 📇 Youth IGF Speaker Bank
docs.text:
A living directory of young professionals, advocates, and experts available to speak at Internet Governance events, panels, workshops, and trainings.

👉 Browse the Speaker Bank Go to Speaker Bank →

For event organizers: You can browse profiles and reach out directly, or open a GitHub Issue if you need help identifying speakers with specific expertise or language requirements.

docs.title: 🌐 IGF Personalities
docs.text:
A curated list of influential voices across Internet Governance, digital policy, advocacy, and research.

👉 Explore IGF Personalities Go to IGF Personalities →

docs.title: 📚 Toolkits: How to Start an IGF
docs.text:
Templates, guides, and practical resources to help you launch or strengthen a national, regional, or youth IGF initiative.

👉 Browse Toolkits Go to Toolkits →

docs.title: 📊 Reports & Outcomes
docs.text:
Reports, outcome documents, and key takeaways from Youth IGF events and national or regional IGF processes around the world.

👉 Browse Reports & Outcomes Go to Reports →

docs.title: 🤝 Contribute
docs.text:
This is a community-driven project, and contributions are welcome.

You can: - 📖 Share a success story - 🎤 Add yourself to the Speaker Bank - 💡 Suggest improvements or corrections

👉 Learn how to contribute Go to the Contribute page →

Not comfortable with GitHub? You can also email your contribution to lilybotsyoe@gmail.com, and a maintainer will help publish it.

docs.title: ✍️ Submit a New Opportunity
docs.text:
Know an opportunity we should list?

Help keep this hub up to date by submitting a new opportunity.

👉 Submit a new opportunity https://github.com/Botsyoelily/internetgovernance-resource-hub/issues/new?template=submit-a-new-opportunity.yml

Submissions open on GitHub and are reviewed before publication. Not comfortable with GitHub? Email the details to lilybotsyoe@gmail.com and a maintainer will assist.

docs.title: 📝 How submissions work
docs.text:
All submissions are collected using GitHub forms.

You can submit: - 🎤 Speaker profiles

  • 🌟 Success stories

  • 💼 Opportunities (events, jobs, fellowships)

Each submission is reviewed by a maintainer before being published on the website.

If you are not comfortable using GitHub, you can also send your content by email to lilybotsyoe@gmail.com.

docs.title: 📘 Website Update Manual
docs.text: This website is built using MkDocs and hosted on GitHub Pages. All content is written in Markdown and stored in this repository.

docs.title: 🔄 How updates happen
docs.text:
1. Content is edited or added (Markdown files)
  2. Changes are committed and pushed to GitHub
  3. A maintainer reviews and approves the changes
  4. Once merged into the main branch:
  5. the website is rebuilt automatically
  6. updates go live within a few minutes

⚠️ No manual deployment is required.

docs.title: Edit existing content
docs.text:
• Navigate to the relevant folder in docs/
  • Edit the corresponding index.md or page
  • Commit and push your changes

docs.title: Add new content
docs.text:
• Create a new folder and index.md under docs/
  • Add it to the navigation in mkdocs.yml
  • Commit and push

docs.title: 🤝 How community members can contribute
docs.text: You can contribute in three ways:

docs.title: 1️⃣ Pull Requests (recommended)
docs.text:
• Fork the repository
  • Make your changes
  • Open a Pull Request

docs.title: 2️⃣ GitHub Issues
docs.text:
• Use the submission templates
  • A maintainer will publish the content

docs.title: 3️⃣ Email submission
docs.text:
• Send your content to lilybotsyoe@gmail.com
  • Maintainers will review and add it

docs.title: 🧭 What lives where
docs.text:
• Knowledge Base: stories, people, toolkits, reports
  • Resource Hub (external): jobs, fellowships, funding, events

This separation helps keep content accurate and up to date.

👉 Prefer forms? Use our submission templates on GitHub: - Submit a Success Story - Join the Speaker Bank - Suggest an improvement

docs.title: 🛠 Need help?
docs.text: Open a GitHub Issue or contact the maintainers. We’re happy to help!

docs.title: 📚 Internet Governance Learning & How to Start an IGF / Toolkit
docs.text:
Resources to enhance your knowledge. Templates, guides, and real examples to help you build your own national, regional, or youth IGF initiative.

Whether you're planning your first Youth IGF or looking to strengthen an existing initiative, this toolkit provides practical resources from communities around the world.

docs.title: Starting Your First Youth IGF: A Beginner's Guide
docs.text:
Type: Guide From: Global Youth IGF Community Year: 2024

A comprehensive walkthrough covering everything from building your organizing team to securing venues, engaging stakeholders, and measuring impact.

Link: [Guide URL]

docs.title: IGF Event Proposal Template
docs.text:
Type: Template From: Africa IGF Year: 2023

Ready-to-use template for submitting event proposals to stakeholders or funders, including budget breakdown and partnership sections.

Link: [Template URL]

docs.title: Session Planning & Agenda Template
docs.text:
Type: Template From: European Youth IGF Year: 2024

Structured template for organizing multi-track IGF events with sample timings, session formats, and speaker coordination tools.

Link: [Template URL]

docs.title: Building Kenya's First Youth IGF from Scratch
docs.text:
Type: Case Study From: Kenya Youth IGF Year: 2024

Real-world account of launching a national Youth IGF with limited resources, including timeline, challenges faced, and key success factors.

Link: [Case Study URL]

docs.title: Sample Grant Application for Youth IGF Events
docs.text:
Type: Template From: Latin America & Caribbean Youth IGF Year: 2023

Successful grant application template that secured funding for regional Youth IGF, including budget justification and impact metrics.

Link: [Template URL]

docs.title: Diversity & Inclusion Toolkit for IGF Events
docs.text:
Type: Toolkit From: Youth IGF Global Initiative Year: 2024

Best practices for ensuring diverse participation across gender, geography, technical background, and lived experience.

Link: [Toolkit URL]

Want to contribute a resource? See the contribution guide in the main repository README.

docs.title: 🌐 Internet Governance Personalities
docs.text:
A living list of influential voices to follow and learn from across tech policy, activism, and thought leadership.

This is a curated directory of people making waves in Internet Governance spaces - policymakers, researchers, activists, technologists, and community leaders whose work shapes the future of the internet.

docs.title: Avri Doria | International
docs.text:
• Role/Affiliation: Independent Internet Governance Researcher and Consultant
  • Known For: Long-time participant in ICANN, IETF, and IGF processes; pioneer in multistakeholder governance models and technical policy development
  • Areas of Focus: Multistakeholder governance, Internet architecture, Policy development
  • Follow: LinkedIn | Website

docs.title: Vint Cerf | United States
docs.text:
• Role/Affiliation: VP and Chief Internet Evangelist at Google
  • Known For: Co-designer of TCP/IP protocols, often called one of the "fathers of the Internet"; strong advocate for open internet access and digital rights
  • Areas of Focus: Internet architecture, Digital inclusion, Future of connectivity
  • Follow: Twitter/X | LinkedIn

docs.title: Fiona Alexander | United States
docs.text:
• Role/Affiliation: Former NTIA Associate Administrator for Global Affairs
  • Known For: Leading the IANA transition process and championing multistakeholder internet governance; pivotal role in DNS policy
  • Areas of Focus: DNS policy, ICANN governance, Multistakeholder processes
  • Follow: LinkedIn | Twitter/X

Want to add someone? See the contribution guide in the main repository README.

docs.title: 📊 Past Internet Governance Reports & Outcomes
docs.text:
Reports, outcome documents, and key takeaways from Youth IGF events and national/regional IGF gatherings around the world.

Learn from past events, see what worked, and get inspired by the recommendations and impact created by IG communities globally.

docs.title: Kenya Youth IGF | November 2024
docs.text:
Location: Nairobi, Kenya Organizer: Kenya Youth IGF Team Participants: ~150

The inaugural Kenya Youth IGF brought together young people from across the country to discuss digital rights, data governance, and youth participation in policy processes. Key recommendations on youth data protection were submitted to the national IGF multistakeholder group.

Documents: - Outcome Document - Full Report - Policy Recommendations

docs.title: Asia-Pacific Youth IGF | August 2024
docs.text:
Location: Bangkok, Thailand Organizer: APrIGF Youth Initiative Participants: ~200

Regional gathering focused on AI governance, digital skills development, and cross-border data flows. Produced a youth statement delivered at the main APrIGF event.

Documents: - Youth Statement - Session Reports

docs.title: Ghana National IGF | October 2023
docs.text:
Location: Accra, Ghana Organizer: Ghana IGF Secretariat Participants: ~300

Multi-stakeholder event addressing cybersecurity, digital identity, and e-governance. Youth track included 50+ participants who contributed recommendations on data protection framework revisions.

Documents: - Outcome Document - Youth Track Report

docs.title: European Youth IGF | June 2023
docs.text:
Location: Brussels, Belgium Organizer: EuroDIG Youth Programme Participants: ~100

Youth-led discussions on platform regulation, content moderation, and digital rights in the context of the Digital Services Act and AI Act.

Documents: - Youth Messages - Full Report

docs.title: Africa IGF Reports Archive
docs.text:
A collection of outcome documents from national and regional IGF events across Africa from 2020-2024.

Link: Archive URL

docs.title: Latin America & Caribbean Youth IGF Archives
docs.text:
Comprehensive archive of Youth IGF reports from LAC region, including multilingual documents.

Link: Archive URL

Want to add a report? See the contribution guide in the main repository README.

docs.title: 📌 Internet Governance Resources
docs.text:
This section provides access to practical opportunities and curated listings across the Internet Governance ecosystem, including jobs, internships, fellowships, funding opportunities, and events.

To keep this knowledge base focused on learning, stories, and people, all opportunity listings are maintained in a dedicated companion project.

docs.title: 🌐 Internet Governance Resource Hub
docs.text:
The Internet Governance Resource Hub is a curated repository of opportunities in:

  • 💼 Jobs & Internships
  • 🎓 Fellowships & Scholarships
  • 💰 Funding & Grants
  • 🗓 Conferences & Events

It is actively maintained and open to community contributions.

👉 Access the Resource Hub here: 🔗 https://github.com/Botsyoelily/internetgovernance-resource-hub

docs.title: 📘 This Knowledge Base (you are here)
docs.text: You can read directly on this website: - Learning toolkits and guides - Research reports and analyses - Success stories and case studies - Speaker profiles and expert banks

docs.title: 🔗 Resource Hub (external)
docs.text:
You will be redirected to GitHub for: - Job and internship listings - Fellowship and scholarship calls - Funding opportunities - Event announcements

This separation helps keep information up to date, focused, and well maintained.

docs.title: ✍️ Contributing Resources
docs.text:
If you would like to: - add a new job, fellowship, or funding opportunity - update an existing listing

Please contribute directly via the Resource Hub repository:

🔗 https://github.com/Botsyoelily/internetgovernance-resource-hub

You can submit: - a Pull Request - a GitHub Issue - or use the provided submission templates

docs.title: 📅 Conferences & Events
docs.text:
This section highlights conferences, forums, summits, and gatherings related to:

  • Internet Governance
  • Tech & Digital Policy
  • Cybersecurity & Privacy
  • Digital Inclusion & Human Rights
  • Open Internet & Internet Infrastructure

Whether you're looking to attend, speak at, or submit proposals, this directory will help you stay updated and involved.

docs.title: 🎤 Youth IGF Speaker Bank
docs.text:
This is a living directory of speakers and subject matter experts from the Youth IGF community.

The goal is to support event organizers in discovering and inviting diverse, knowledgeable youth speakers in areas like digital rights, governance, inclusion, security, and policy.

docs.title: Amina Said | Kenya
docs.text:
• Topics of Expertise: AI Ethics, Youth Participation, Digital Inclusion
  • Languages: English, Swahili
  • Available For: Panels, Moderation
  • Link: LinkedIn

docs.title: Daniel Kojo | Ghana
docs.text:
• Topics of Expertise: IGF Strategy, Policy Advocacy
  • Languages: English
  • Available For: Panels, Training
  • Link: Profile

docs.title: Linh Nguyen | Vietnam
docs.text:
• Topics of Expertise: Cybersecurity, Privacy, Women in IG
  • Languages: English, Vietnamese
  • Available For: Speaking, Mentorship
  • Link: Link

docs.title: Yao Amevi Amessinou Sossou | Benin/Austria
docs.text:
Topics of Expertise: Internet Governance, Digital Policy & Regulation, Youth Participation, Multistakeholder Processes, AI Governance, Platform Regulation (DSA), Data Protection & Digital Rights, Internet Governance in Africa

Languages: English, French, German(converstional)

Available For: Panels, Workshops, Moderation, Policy Dialogues, Trainings, Academic & Community Events

Bio: Yao Amevi A. Sossou is a policy researcher and Internet Governance practitioner with extensive experience in youth engagement, digital policy, and multistakeholder processes in Africa and beyond. He currently serves as Policy Chair of the Not-for-Profit Operational Concerns Constituency (NPOC) at ICANN and coordinates the Youth IGF Benin Initiative. Using his technical background his works span research, policy advocacy, and community building, with a strong focus on inclusive governance, platform accountability, and sustainable digital development.

[LinkedIn: ]LinkedIn(https://www.linkedin.com/in/ameviy/)

--

Want to join the Speaker Bank?

You can submit your profile in two ways:

Option 1 — GitHub (recommended): 👉 Submit your speaker profile https://github.com/Botsyoelily/internetgovernance-resource-hub/issues/new?template=speaker-profile.yml

Option 2 — No GitHub account: ✉️ Email your details to lilybotsyoe@gmail.com

All submissions are reviewed before publication.

docs.title: 🌟 Success Stories
docs.text: Real stories from the Internet Governance community showing how engagement, advocacy, and collaboration create meaningful change.

docs.title: ✍️ Share Your Success Story
docs.text:
Have a success story to share?

We welcome stories from individuals, communities, and organizations working in Internet Governance.

👉 Submit a success story

Submissions open on GitHub and are reviewed before publication. Not comfortable with GitHub? Email your story to lilybotsyoe@gmail.com and a maintainer will help you.

docs.title: Building Kenya's First Youth IGF | 2024
docs.text:
By: Amina Said & Team | Kenya Category: Community Building

After attending the global IGF, a group of young Kenyans recognized the need for local youth voices in Internet Governance discussions. They launched Kenya Youth IGF in 2024, bringing together 150+ young people from across the country for a two-day forum on digital rights and policy. The event produced concrete policy recommendations that were submitted to the national IGF and resulted in two youth representatives being appointed to Kenya's IGF multistakeholder group.

Key Takeaway: Start small, document everything, and don't wait for perfect conditions — the community will show up if you build the space.

Contact: LinkedIn

docs.title: From Fellow to Policy Influencer | 2023
docs.text:
By: Daniel Kojo | Ghana Category: Policy Influence

As an IGF Fellowship recipient, Daniel conducted research on data protection gaps in West Africa. His work caught the attention of Ghana's Data Protection Commission, leading to an invitation to contribute to national data governance guidelines. The research findings influenced three specific provisions in Ghana's updated data protection framework, particularly around youth data rights and consent mechanisms.

Key Takeaway: Rigorous research + strategic relationship-building = real policy impact. Fellows should actively share their work with relevant policymakers.

Contact: Website

docs.title: Connecting Women Across Borders | 2023–2024
docs.text:
By: Asia-Pacific Women in Cybersecurity Collective Category: Capacity Building

What started as an informal Signal group of 15 women working in cybersecurity policy across Asia-Pacific has grown into a 200+ member network. The collective now runs monthly knowledge-sharing sessions, maintains a job board, and has successfully advocated for increased women's representation at regional IGF events. In 2024, 40% of speakers at APrIGF were women, up from 22% in 2022.

Key Takeaway: Informal networks can evolve into powerful advocacy platforms. Create the space first, structure can come later.
